title: 108_hr2097
content: Changes in threshold and tests for determining wages subject to social security and Medicare taxes for agricultural workers. Increase in $150 Remuneration Threshold to $1,000 and Total Farm Payroll Test increased to $50,000 for determining wages subject to social security and Medicare taxes for agricultural workers. Adjustment for inflation also included. The $1,000 and $50,000 thresholds for determining wages subject to social security and Medicare taxes for agricultural workers will be adjusted for inflation. The cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years beginning in 2002 will be determined by substituting 'calendar year 2002' for 'calendar year 1992'. Any increase not a multiple of $50 will be rounded down. Additionally, for agricultural labor after 2003, the $1,000 threshold for wages subject to social security taxes will be adjusted for inflation. After 2003, the $1,000 and $50,000 thresholds for wages subject to social security taxes will be increased in the same manner as specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Additionally, full-time students under 18 years of age performing agricultural labor are exempt from certain tax provisions. The Social Security Act was amended to exempt full-time students under 18 years of age who perform agricultural labor from certain tax provisions. The amendments apply to remuneration paid after December 31, 2003. SEC. 2. COORDINATION OF COLLECTION OF AGRICULTURAL LABOR EMPLOYMENT TAXES WITH COLLECTION OF INCOME TAXES. The amendment to section 3510 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 defines eligible employment taxes as domestic service employment taxes and agricultural labor employment taxes. Domestic service employment taxes include taxes on remuneration for services in a private home and amounts withheld under section 3402(p). The term 'agricultural labor employment taxes' includes taxes imposed on remuneration for agricultural labor and amounts withheld under section 3402(p). The heading of section 3510 is amended to include 'AND AGRICULTURAL LABOR' after 'DOMESTIC SERVICE'. The section is amended to include "AND AGRICULTURAL LABOR" after "DOMESTIC SERVICE". Various subsections are amended to replace "domestic service employment taxes" with "eligible employment taxes". The effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2003.
